intro: Hirtella tubiflora, commonly known as the woolly hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Hirtella tubiflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
